last_episode_to_air.name: The Silkwood
last_episode_to_air.overview: Billy moves to Los Angeles with Julie's help. Marilyn writes a best-selling memoir, also with Julie's help. Changes at the cafe include a new waiter, and eventually, new ownership. Arthur’s office in Florida meets an untimely demise.

name: Difficult People
overview: Life is really tough for Julie Kessler and Billy Epstein, two thirty-something aspiring comics living and working in New York City. While their friends and acquaintances move on to find success and love, they continue to struggle with careers and relationships, getting more bitter by the day.

episodes.name: Library Water
episodes.overview: Billy and Julie come up with an entrepreneurial scheme to sell bottled library water fountain water; Julie gets in trouble for a controversial tweet.

episodes.name: Devil's Three-Way
episodes.overview: Julie seeks out an old high school crush and brings him to bed with her and Arthur; Billy finds a father figure in Denise's husband, Nate.

episodes.name: Difficult Christmas
episodes.overview: Julie and Billy book a gig at The Cutting Room, but Billy's newfound obligation to family threatens to compromise their big break.

episodes.name: Unplugged
episodes.overview: Julie works to impress Jewish TV writers as Billy strives to be his rich boyfriend's kept man; meanwhile, Marilyn makes a video will.

episodes.name: Kessler Epstein Foundation
episodes.overview: Billy and Julie decide to create their own version of the Ice Bucket Challenge to gain internet fame.

episodes.name: Italian Pinata
episodes.overview: Mistaken perceptions about heritage and sexual orientation leads to Julie and Billy living double lives in New Jersey.

episodes.name: Blade Stallion
episodes.overview: Time alone become elusive after Julie is caught watching porn and Billy's brother moves in with him.

episodes.name: Patches
episodes.overview: When Billy’s apartment is condemned, he moves in with Marilyn; a misunderstanding lands Julie a role on a TV show.

episodes.name: 36 Candles
episodes.overview: As her birthday approaches, Julie learns that she enjoys her mother’s company when they drink together, and Billy tries to date a guy he befriended on Tinder.

episodes.name: Carter
episodes.overview: Julie and Billy attempt to capitalize on the success of Hamilton by writing and starring in their own historical musical.

episodes.name: Hashtag Cats
episodes.overview: Billy and Julie get their first famous fan, who helps them try to sell a sketch show to a TV network.

episodes.name: Cedar Cove
episodes.overview: Julie and Billy jeopardize their shot at becoming fashion elites when Julie gets sick and Billy gets cast as the lead in a children’s TV show.

episodes.name: High Alert
episodes.overview: Julie writes an essay that is optioned for a movie, Billy helps with Matthew’s wedding. Julianne Moore stars as a development executive. Richard Kind stars as a writer who helps adapt Julie’s essay. Amy Sedaris and Deborah Harry return as roommates.

episodes.name: Passover Bump
episodes.overview: Having maxed out on antidepressants, Julie faces a family Passover Seder armed only with a meditation app. Meanwhile, Billy gets a gig as a warm-up comic for Larry Wilmore's new late-night talk show and Arthur heads to Florida for work.

episodes.name: Strike Rat
episodes.overview: Julie faces a moral dilemma when she gets cast in Woody Allen's new TV show; Billy and Marilyn scam their way through a government gay conversion therapy program. Matthew's ex-wife comes to town.

episodes.name: Code Change
episodes.overview: Julie decides she has an addiction to her mother, and treats it by joining AA. Billy helps his sister-in-law Rucchel exorcise a Jewish demon from her basement. Arthur experiences frustration in the bedroom and at work, and takes both into his own hands.

episodes.name: Rabbitversary
episodes.overview: Alone for the weekend, Julie hires a creepy handyman who overstays his welcome. Meanwhile, Billy feuds with a dickish advertising exec, and Marilyn gets a book deal.

episodes.name: Cindarestylox
episodes.overview: After cut-rate facial filler leaves Julie's face frozen into a smile, she savors the unexpected benefits. Billy has the opportunity to teach acting after running into his favorite school teacher, and Marilyn wants Julie to freeze her eggs.

episodes.name: Bernie and Blythe
episodes.overview: Julie and Arthur stumble into sexual roleplay, while Billy worries he's been miscast as a supportive spouse at Todd's work parties. Meanwhile, Julie's dogs become social media stars without Julie's consent, and Marilyn re-unites with a former lover.

episodes.name: Fuzz Buddies
episodes.overview: Lifelong dreams come true when Julie gets hired to write on a TV show, Micky Dolenz answers Billy's childhood fan letter, and Marilyn throws herself a Bat Mitzvah.

episodes.name: Criminal Minds
episodes.overview: Julie "Yes And's" her way into a corner with her former improv teammates and ends up being caught in a significant lie. Billy and Todd can't fall asleep in the same bed together. Meanwhile, Arthur uncovers a secret at work and Marilyn and Matthew bond.

episodes.name: Sweet Tea
episodes.overview: Julie thinks about trading in her show business dreams for a life of crafting; Billy tires of New York; Arthur is fed up with his job; Marilyn has writer's block.

episodes.name: The Silkwood
episodes.overview: Billy moves to Los Angeles with Julie's help. Marilyn writes a best-selling memoir, also with Julie's help. Changes at the cafe include a new waiter, and eventually, new ownership. Arthur’s office in Florida meets an untimely demise.
